metadata.title: Tanium-SCCMClientHealth
metadata.description:
Tanium's real-time data can speed up investigations by providing important context for analysts, such as pulling back Microsoft Configuration Manager (formerly SCCM) Health.
This playbook starts with a Microsoft Sentinel incident, gets the hosts associated with that incident, queries the Tanium API Gateway for the SCCM Client Health for those hosts, and then adds a comment to the incident with that information.

See [Tanium Help](https://help.tanium.com/bundle/ConnectAzureSentinel/page/Integrations/MSFT/ConnectAzureSentinel/Overview.htm) for a guide to setting up the Tanium Connector for Sentinel.
prerequisites: 1. Microsoft Sentinel incidents with associated hosts.

2. A [Tanium API Token](https://help.tanium.com/bundle/ug_console_cloud/page/platform_user/console_api_tokens.html) granting access to your Tanium environment: the query will be made with the user privileges of that token.
4. Permission to Assign Roles to the Resource Group

metadata.description: The name to use for the Microsoft Sentinel Connector in the Logic App . (This will exist as an API Connection in your subscription)
The name of an existing Azure Integration Account (required to run inline JavaScript actions)
The resource group name for the existing Azure Integration Account
The Tanium API Token used for this logic app. The logic app will be restricted to the level of access available to the user who generated the token.
The hostname for your Tanium server's API. For cloud customers use <customerName>-api.cloud.tanium.com. For on-prem use the hostname of your server.
The Tanium API Token provides access to the Tanium Server. Access is restricted to the level of access available to the user who generated the token.

variables.name: apiQuery

Initialize_API_Query.description: To check this query against a Tanium Server question use this in the query variables: {"source":{"ts":{"stableWaitTime":10}}}

body.message: No data found in Tanium for hosts.

Switch_to_TS_from_TDS_if_needed.description: Switch from asking the Tanium Server for information to using the Tanium Data Service.

contains: must refer to an existing sensor

Parse_endpoints_array.description: We need an action's output to use in the JavaScript code since it can't read from a variable
